Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Managing users and user roles.
Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analyst if necessary.
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.

Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
Training end users on new reports and dashboards.

Build strong business relationships that foster a collaborative and trusting approach and partnership

About this Job:


Disrupting the marketplace for more than 25 years, CarMax is the largest used car retailer in the US. Our success is a direct result of our customer-centric, data-informed approach to problem solving and an unparalleled focus on a company culture that supports our employees and our community.

As a Business Analyst, you will play a key part in driving our success for the future. This entry-level, 24-month rotational position will provide recent college graduates the opportunity to apply strategic thinking, problem solving, and analytics to unique and complex problems influencing company performance and success from Day 1.

How you will impact CarMax:


Research & Analytics - Business Analysts are the analytical authorities at CarMax. Apply analytical rigor to CarMax's proprietary, industry-leading data to formulate and test theories about specific business areas. Leverage your new insights in combination with advanced analytical techniques to develop insightful metrics and predictive models.

Strategy Consulting - Business Analysts are key collaborators driving major corporate functions and initiatives and are encouraged to work proactively and independently. They work closely with leadership in field execution, technology, marketing, and other business areas, to inform our strategy and execution. They help CarMax create powerful, compelling narratives and influence corporate decision-making at the most senior levels.

What we offer:

CarMax Analyst Rotation Program: To maximize professional development and career growth, new Analysts join a 24-month rotational program. This enables you to develop the breadth of skills and experiences necessary to drive success. Career Progression: The program ensures new analysts work on high value opportunities - reporting to Sr. Leaders every 8 months at a minimum. Focusing on results rather than tenure, CarMax has many career opportunities for internal progression at a fast-growing, best-of-breed company.
Robust Training: CarMax provides hands-on training focusing on areas such as Analysis & Decision Making, Communication and Influence, and coding languages such as SQL, Python or SAS. CarMax's training has been recognized as one of the most successful learning and development programs by Training Magazine for over 10 years. You can expect to use the following software in your rotations:
SQL
Python
Tableau
Excel
PowerBI
And more!
Vibrant community: Join our community of more than 150 Analysts, from various backgrounds and experiences, and develop professional relationships that expand your focus area. CarMax has been named one of the '100 Best Places to Work' by FORTUNE magazine for 15 consecutive years and was recognized recently by FlexJobs & Forbes as a top company for millennials seeking work-life balance.
Competitive benefits: Flexible time away, work-life balance, company contributions to health care, retirement plans & stock investments

What you need to succeed:

Passion for problem-solving and desire to develop into a strong business leader
Top-caliber critical thinking skills and curious personality
Highly organized and proven ability to multitask
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills
Dedication to continuous improvement and innovation
Passion for growth, development, and learning new things

To be eligible:

Must be legally authorized to work for any U.S. employer on a full-time basis without the need for sponsorship now or in the future

Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We've implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we're all in this together.

Work Location


Associates will have the opportunity to work in our Auto Finance office in Kennesaw, GA.

Bitcoin Depot (bitcoindepot.com) is the world's leading and fastest growing cryptocurrency ATM network. The Marketing Data Analyst will report to the Sr. Performance Marketing Manager and lead data analyst work to analyze, understand, and report on our paid search, outbound email, SMS, and paid social media activities. This person will also work closely with other teammates to help create the above-mentioned campaigns to increase customer acquisition and retention efforts. This is a business-critical position that will report on ROI measures. Part strategy and part execution, this opportunity influences cross-functional leaders within the Bitcoin Depot.

If you consider yourself a seasoned Marketing Data Analyst and have an incredible work ethic, perhaps this rare opportunity is for you. But I warn you, we're looking for all-stars, not the average.

Excellent writing and presentation skills

Proficient with proposing high-level design of data integrations, and UI enhancements. Storyboarding of new features and processes

SeKON is looking for a Public Health Data Analyst to join our talented and innovative team supporting the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) in Atlanta, GA. Due to COVID-19, this role will be 100% remote for the foreseeable future.
With over 20 years of experience, SeKON specializes in providing large-scale health IT programs in support of federal government customers including the Centers for Disease Control (CDC), Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), Defense Health Agency (DHA), and National Institutes of Health (NIH). Our vision “To be the premier management and technology consulting firm providing solutions that improve quality of life and work”.
The Public Health Data Analyst, primarily using SAS and SUDAAN, will manage and analyze quantitative epidemiological, clinical and/or behavioral data and provide output in the format requested. Some specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Conduct analysis and interpretation of data in SAS and SUDAAN.
Enter definitions of variables for survey questionnaires, including variable names, range labels, default values, and question strings.
Generate data retrievals and summary outputs.
Support dissemination and reporting of data to stakeholders.
Write SAS programs to generate surveillance reports.
Provide routine analysis and interpretation of data, as well as data entry, coding, and transcription.
Develop presentation graphics, Including MS Office products (PowerPoint, Word, Excel).
Perform literature searches and summarize findings from the resulting literature.
Develop SAS programs for managing and validating data.
Review output from the SAS programs, identify problems in the output (to make corrections in the way data are collected)
Review data error logs to ensure that requested data modifications are done according to the protocol.
Identify errors/omissions of variable formats or labels.
Document problems and proposed corrections before finalizing the data set.
Review the data files to document problems and proposed corrections needed to be made to finalize the data set.
Review the quality of the weights as indicated.
Document problems with the SAS program and any proposed corrections needed to finalize the data.
Review the SAS programs generated to create analysis variables for the cycle by comparing the code with similar SAS code known to be valid for creating the variable (e.g., from past cycles or another programmer) or by generating cross-tabulations of the variables comprising the analysis variables.
Merge data from different sources into spreadsheets; conduct necessary steps to ensure quality of the resulting merge.
Assist with developing data management processes and protocols.


REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s degree in public health, statistics, or related field.
2 years of experience in generating SUDAAN or SAS-based reports using a variety of methods (e.g., PROC REPORT, PROC TABULATE) and exporting those reports to other formats such as Microsoft Excel, PDF, and HTML.
Skill in manipulating and cleaning data using a variety of SAS functions, formats/informats, macros, and procedures.
Demonstrated ability to work with multiple data sources to monitor and assess data to ensure data quality, including accuracy and completeness.
Preferred Skills:
Master’s degree in public health, statistics, or related field.
Knowledge of public health promotion programs
Knowledge of behavioral and social science research methods.
Experience preparing with research papers or presentations.
Detail oriented and able to create meticulous documentation of variables, datasets and data attributes with a commitment to generating accurate data and products
Strong organizational and interpersonal skills

At LeasePlan, we are always asking What's next in mobility.

OBJECTIVE
The Risk Data Analyst will be responsible for the development, operation, and maintenance of analytical tools, approaches and processes to understand current and emerging risk exposures. Provide analytical support across the entire risk universe and will apply innovative and scientific/quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make recommendations to answer business objectives and drive change using maturing knowledge. Core to the function is asset risk analytics and modeling, which in the case of LPUS consist of leased vehicle assets, and include residual value analytics and modeling, recalculations, back testing and stress testing our internal models. As such this function is a key contributor with direct impact on LPUS overall performance. Key role in ensuring that the LPUS makes informed, data driven and risk sensitive decisions.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Independently conduct quantitative analytics and modeling projects, including but not limited to:
Preparing, analyzing and interpreting multiple risk reports, and conducting various ad-hoc risk and portfolio analyses.
Developing and maintaining various risk models, analytic processes and systems approaches, as well as relevant documentation.
Participating in multiple task forces, addressing new regulation, legislation, new products, etc.
Actively identify areas of improvement and implement the appropriate changes to the technical residual value setting process to ensure that LeasePlan is estimating future market values for our leased vehicles as accurately as possible by reacting to macro and micro changes in the economic and automotive industry.
Utilizes advanced analytics to manage processes and databases for existing asset risk activities, including Market Value Guide, Residual Value Matrices.
Create statistical reporting and financial analysis to forecast results for stress test scenarios.
Support operating lease team delivery of client related depreciation requests, non-standard lifecycle cost requests, equity position analysis, and/or ad-hoc financial and risk modeling in a timely and accurate manner.
Create and maintain existing Asset Risk Management related policies, procedures, and work instructions to comply with applicable internal and external requirements.
Other duties assigned to ensure overall departmental efficiency.
OTHER DUTIES
Manage monthly governance deliverables to ensure all current risk related developments are appropriately communicated and addressed.
Proactively review available external and internal industry and economic data to identify trends that could impact LPUS's asset risk position.
Assists with communicating analytical results, findings and solutions to governance committees and business process owners and influences business analysis.
Collaborate with teams across business to ensure proper understanding, buy-in and implementation of analytical solutions and outcomes.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

This is a Full-time position and hours of work are Monday through Friday; 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.
TRAVEL
No travel is expected for this position.

Deep understanding of statistical, economic, financial, and leasing concepts.

Skilled and experienced in predictive modeling. SAS, SQL and R coding knowledge and experience.

Overview:

Karna, LLC is recruiting for a Sr. Data Manager/Analyst to support proposed work being done at the Center for Disease Control & Prevention, in Atlanta GA. The candidate will provide advanced-level of database management, science and programming in SAS or R. Support includes activities such as creating, revising or enhancing existing SAS and R code. Executing, maintaining and managing SAS import and QA program and data, providing recommendations for automating and improving new and current import QA SAS programs and processes to prepare analysis files. Creating new and enhancing existing project data documentation with the intent to make it more useful to project members; and utilizing abilities in data visualization and automating reports.
Responsibilities:
Provide advanced-level SAS programming, R programming, and intermediate level Microsoft SQL database programming expertise for database management, data quality checks, analysis file preparation, data transfers to other formats (e.g., Microsoft excel, word, access), for data analysis of large injury-related data systems and surveys; experience with advance SAS programming using SAS macros and other advanced programming methods/techniques is needed to perform these duties.
Develop or revise standard operating procedures (SOPs) for data management.
Develop or revise tracking systems to monitor data management processes including receipt of data, generation of QC programs, data validation, and creation of state-based datasets.
Adapt currently developed SAS programs and develop R programs to query databases with customized text (i.e. chief complaint, clinical impression, and triage note fields).
Provide in-depth knowledge and expertise related to the data systems, web-based systems, and surveys maintained in the Epidemiology and Surveillance group in order to:
Support various surveillance projects related to computer automated data management, quality assurance/quality control, and analyses of fatal and nonfatal drug overdose data;
Assist in coordinating data submitted by funded health departments to NCIPC in various formats (e.g. excel, web-based SQL platform) for use in mortality and morbidity surveillance studies and the provision of public use data.
Provide data management support in the development, implementation, and evaluation of the surveillance strategies as they relate to IT and data processing objectives.
Document and maintain data in compliance with all Federal regulations related to information security.

Knowledge and understanding of ICD-10-CM is preferred
Knowledge of mortality surveillance data

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Summary:
The Sr. Data Analyst works within the Investment Advisory compliance department supporting the IA Compliance Officer. The Sr. Data Analyst role requires a data-minded individual who has experience in writing complex reports and is familiar with the financial services industry, especially as it relates to Investment Advisory compliance regulations.
Responsibilities:
Forensic Testing – Develop ad hoc reports to support forensic testing efforts as part of the annual review required by SEC rule 206(4)-7. Forensic testing will be used to test for previously unidentified issues by:
Gaining additional insight from data, other information or evidence evaluated in new ways from current information sources, and in additional ways from new information sources
Determining whether currently undiscovered circumstances are in fact, present
Exploring uncertainties
Acting on one’s instincts and with skepticism, as in asking questions of “what if,” “what about,” or “how do we know”
Quality Assurance – As an extension of forensic testing, perform quality assurance on integrity of data provided by IT directly to IA Compliance, or operational functions where IA Compliance has oversight.
Support Regulatory Inquiries – Provide support to the regulatory affairs team on regulatory data requests for RIA entities.
Assists with special projects, including creating compliance reports based upon deficiencies and / or recommendations from regulatory inquiries.
Perform Monitoring & Surveillance over business processes and controls
All other duties as assigned.

Two to five years of relevant work experience with a financial institution such as a broker/dealer, registered investment adviser, regulatory agency, or other financial institution.
Proficiency in MS SQL Server and Excel is required
Strong written and verbal communication skills

FINRA Series 7 preferred

Job Title: Data Analyst
Location: Conyers, GA
What we’re looking for:
We are looking for an innovative and experienced data analyst to join our team. The data analyst will work closely with business leaders to provide information to reduce quality costs and improve processes. To be successful as a quality analyst, you should have a strong background working with data and proven ability to demonstrate strong attention to detail along with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate must be able to interpret and implement quality assurance data standards and provide accurate and comprehensive feedback to the business. You will be responsible for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualizing data from a wide variety of sources as it relates to the performance of our products, services and key business processes.
What you’ll be responsible for in this role:
Exploring any and all available data for extraction, transformation, analysis and visualization, incl. proposing new ideas and solutions.
Design, development, maintenance and improvement of processes and tools for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualization of data.
Development and maintenance of tools aimed at automation of existing processes and data bases.
Working closely with end users to translate requirements into data-driven applications and data visualization solutions (e.g. reporting and dashboards).
Transforming data into value: communicating findings and recommended actions across the entire company in an international environment.
Work with business leaders to identify opportunities for improvement
Create reports for internal and external teams
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data
Use graphs, infographics and other methods to visualize data
Design and assist in implementation of quality data warehouse
Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions
Structure large data sets into usable information
Work with a team to process information
Create presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings
Perform data integrity reviews
What are the basic qualifications?
5+ years of experience as a data analyst
Bachelor’s degree in business, Science, Engineer, or Data Analysis
To be a great fit for the role:
Mastery of programming tools such as SQL, PL/SQL, Python or R.
Master Excel at an advanced level with Visual Basic. Experience on Power BI is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication and the ability to present data to all levels in the organization.
ERP and Lean Six Sigma certification are a plus.
Experience writing queries to select and/or update data in a relational database like MSSQL server, Oracle or similar
Ability to create dashboards, spreadsheet analysis, and presentations using reporting and data visualization software like, Excel, Power BI, Tableau or similar tools
Ability to QA and troubleshoot data issues
Ability to define and document data, system, and reporting requirements
Ability to Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Understanding of data warehousing, ETL, data cleansing, and transformation techniques
How We Define Our Values and Why You Should Join Our Team:
The backbone behind our collection of outstanding businesses is a team of dedicated employees who protect and enhance our valued reputation for quality and delivering what we promise. These values must be expressed in our work and embody our actions, as they form the basis by which we do our jobs, make decisions and measure our performance. It’s our unwavering commitment to maintaining our values that defines who we are as a Company.

Summary of Role
Our Compensation teams are the global leaders in effectively aligning executive, broad-based and sales employee pay and other rewards with the interests of our clients’ stakeholders. Our team consults to a broad array of clients on matters related to compensation benchmarking and plan design/calibration, corporate governance, legislative and regulatory trends, performance analysis and risk management, among others.

Gypsum Management & Supply, Inc. (NYSE: GMS) is the leading North American specialty distributor of interior building products. The company’s product offerings of wallboard, ceilings and complementary interior construction products are designed to provide a comprehensive solution for its core customer, the interior contractor who installs these products in commercial and residential buildings. GMS serves as a critical link between its suppliers and a highly fragmented customer base of over 20,000 contractors. The company’s operating model combines a national platform with a local go-to-market strategy, enabling GMS to generate economies of scale while maintaining the high service levels, entrepreneurial culture and customer intimacy of a local business.

Celebrating its 50th anniversary in 2021, GMS operates a national network of approximately 265 distribution centers across the U.S. and Canada and provides a one-stop-shop for all customers. The Corporate Headquarters and Yard Support Center in Tucker, Georgia serves each GMS location, providing the support needed to enable them to continue their outstanding service to contractors and builders in their local communities.

GMS’s growth strategy is centered around four core initiatives which guides the long-term management of a very attractive business with significant long-term growth potential. These strategic growth initiatives include:

Increasing market share in core products, particularly in geographies where we are under-penetrated;
Growing select complementary products outside of core products to diversify and profitably expand our product offering;
Expanding the geographic platform through accretive acquisition and greenfield opportunities and;
Leveraging our scale and employing technology and best practices to deliver a best-in-class customer experience, as well as increased productivity and further profit improvement.

GMS KEY FACTS

Headquarters: Tucker, Georgia (20 min. from downtown Atlanta)
Employees: Nearly 6,000 people who embrace a strong entrepreneurial culture
2020 Revenues: $3.2 billion
NYSE: GMS (IPO in 2016)

GMS' STRATEGIC ADVANTAGE POISED FOR CONTINUED GROWTH

Market-leading distributor of interior building products with significant scale and local expertise
Differentiated service model drives market leadership
Multiple levers to drive growth: organic, greenfields, M&A, operating leverage
Capitalizing on growth in large, diverse end markets
Entrepreneurial culture with dedicated employees and experienced leadership driving superior execution

VISSION, MISSION AND VALUES

Vision: We will be the premier distributor in every market we serve through embracing our unique culture and professional humility.

Mission: We create opportunities, build significant relationships and deliver solutions.

Values: At GMS –

Our people have the independence and authority to make a difference.
We invest in relationships, and every person is important.
Our highest priority is serving others.
We passionately pursue a safe work environment along with a relentless focus on operational excellence.
We believe you can never go wrong doing the right thing.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Master Data Analyst with Gypsum Management and Supply, Inc. is a strategic business facing role that will work with cross functional teams across all of GMS to help implement a framework for data governance and standardization. This role will engage with business functions in our HQ location as well as our field leadership teams to understand business goals and define data and process requirements to achieve those goals. Working with internal technology teams to establish standards and automation, where possible, to maintain data integrity and one version of the truth across the enterprise.

Duties and Responsibilities

Help develop and implement the master data governance framework, with a focus on improving data quality through modifications to behaviors, business processes, policies, standards, and metrics.

Assist in cleansing data records that do not comply with established standards to ensure quality of master data.

Be responsible for troubleshooting data issues and determining causes/solutions.

Proactively monitor and report on processes critical to MDM data integrity in order to facilitate accountability.

Partner with business and IT teams to coordinate cross-functional data needs and translate them into master data designs.

Assist in building management and executive support for required changes to achieve MDM goals and requirements.

Participate in M&A activities to assess the impact of master data standards on the integration process for specified domain.

Maintain ongoing data stewardship across end-to-end processes after the initial implementation of data governance process and systems.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, business or equivalent experience

5+ years of experience in Data cleansing, Data standardization, Data Governance, and Business Process Analysis

Strong foundation SQL, Digital Catalog, and MDM processes

Demonstrate functional understanding of key processes creating or consuming data within all governed domains and the ability to determine the interrelationships and usage across the enterprise.

Ability to work with vendors to facilitate cooperation of data feeds to achieve MDM goals.

Strong leadership, communication and collaboration skillsets.

Ability to think strategically while operating tactically to implement global data standards and global technical/process solutions

Experience collaborating cross-functionally in a matrix structure and influencing peers and stakeholders

Experience diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues while addressing root cause issues and preventing repeated issues.

Experience with ERP implementations, data mapping, cleansing, and migration management

Strong communication skills and ability to deliver a common message tailored to the specific audience.

Physical Demands:

Must be able to remain in stationary position 70%
Occasionally, will move about inside the office to access files, office machinery, etc.
Must be able to operate basic office machinery
Must be able to communicate with team and management and be able to exchange accurate information in these situations
Constantly working in office environment

Mental Demands:

Must be able to problem solve and prioritize tasks
Must be able to manage stress depending on tasks
Must be able to multitask
Must be able to receive and analyze information
Must be able to quickly communicate solutions if problems occur
Must be able to demonstrate a high degree of sound judgement
Company Benefits:

Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability & Life Insurance
401k
Paid holidays & vacation days
This job description is subject to change at any time.

The Master Data Analyst will be responsible for entering, modifying and confirming Material Master Data in the SAP enterprise databases as defined by policy and procedure, meeting agreed upon data entry Service Level Agreements, and with problem resolution as required.
In addition, this role will support key strategic departmental objectives, including but not limited to:
The extension of current business rules and processes to cover global requirements
The tracking of data quality improvements
Support (as needed) for data conversion ahead of future SAP deployments around the globe
The position will have an impact on several functions of the company as central master data is a critical component of an SAP environment. The position will need to provide services to all facilities and assigned functions within agreed upon service levels to maintain business speed and continuance. Meeting these performance objectives will allow the business to be responsive to the internal and external customers
Responsibilities & Qualifications:

Coordinate initiatives across Regions and functional Business Groups

Experience in data cleansing, classification and coding of transactions

Excellent communication skills (written & oral)
Proficiency in MS Office (Word/Excel/PowerPoint)

Job Description:
3M HIS Business Process Program Analyst
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World
Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 96,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.
“At 3M, thanks to our culture where people feel like they belong, can grow and are appreciated, we are more than the sum of our parts. Our different perspectives and experiences help us solve some of the world’s toughest challenges together.” – Zoe Dickson, executive vice president and chief Human Resources officer at 3M
This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career.
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
As a Business Process Program Analyst, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:
Establishes and leads projects linked to business process goals with defined expected results typically small to medium in scale. Present project results and recommendations to appropriate personnel that demonstrate sound planning in support of business needs and goals.
Handles non-routine and difficult inquiries and adapts differing techniques and methods to develop solutions for a variety of complex issues. Applies analytical skills for analysis and interpretation of trends or data generated by company reporting systems, statistical results, or other information collection systems.
Work tasks are likely to encompass concepts within multiple disciplines/practices which may include more than one

department/location.
Establish and maintain scheduled events for Business Process Excellence
Support tracking and reporting of hires, turnover and allocation of resources by named programs within HISD
Summarize and prepare presentations on operational results for senior management
Exercise discretion in matters of confidentiality
Protects the corporation and assures 3M values and policies are upheld and complied to, as well as that 3M

processes are implemented as appropriate. Ensures compliance with 3M Business Conduct Policies and other

policies, and teaches and acts as an example of uncompromising ethics.
Participate in project planning with internal and external clients and serves as a facilitator to develop communication plans and execution plans to ensure project support across Business/Functional Units.
Perform additional duties as assigned
Your Skills and Expertise
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or higher (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited university
OR
High School Diploma/GED (completed and verified prior to start) and eight (8) years of experience in leading projects
Five (5) years of experience in complex project coordination or business analysis
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
Ability to analyze data and suggest and present recommended courses of action using appropriate charts, statistics and graphics
Ability to coordinate and plan and lead complex multi-location, multi-team meetings
Location: Atlanta GA or Remote
Travel: May include up to 10% travel
Relocation Assistance: May be authorized
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).
Supporting Your Well-being
3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.
Resources for You
For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.
Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.
Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.
Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. You have flexibility in where and when work gets done. It all depends on where and when you can do your best work.

job description:
Bring your Passion and Enthusiasm to our Team! We are a fun, innovative and growing Change Team where you’ll get the opportunity to learn multiple insurance products and interact with business leaders across the organization.
Position: Business Analyst
Reporting to: Lead Business Analyst
Location: Atlanta
Band: I
What is the role?
Hiscox USA is currently seeking a Business Analyst to work closely with the business in the primary role of orchestrating visibility and prioritization of business change so that we maximize the value of resource investments to deliver the agreed business plan. The Business Analyst mainly supports larger/medium sized projects by documenting business needs and requirements. Critical thinking, good communication, and initiative are essential in this high-pressure environment of rapid change. This role will report directly to the Broker Lead Business Analyst and is based in Atlanta.
Key Role Responsibilities:
Serve as a liaison between Business, IT, Operations stakeholders and users within projects.
Perform requirements analysis and produce business requirements documents.
Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements, and all impacted stakeholders are engaged.
Conduct meetings and presentations to share recommendations and findings.
Coordinate and perform user acceptance testing. Facilitate user training.
Create business process flows.
Monitor deliverables and ensure timely completion of tasks.
Leverage business and IT knowledge to uncover areas for improvement and develop/implement solutions.
Stay up-to-date on the latest business analysis processes and IT advancements.

person specification:
Person Specification
Minimum of 2 years of experience in business analysis or a related field within Insurance.
Understanding of the software development lifecycle and different delivery models.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Understanding of PMO and governance process.
Advanced technical skills.
Team-oriented.
Process-oriented.
Positive attitude.
Excellent documentation skills and attention to detail.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, Outlook, Project and exposure to different reporting tools. Experience with JIRA is ideal.
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
A history of leading and supporting successful projects.
Ability to travel up to 20% of time.
Adaptive in an ever changing market and growing organization.
Hiscox Values
At Hiscox our spirit is in Challenging Convention and everything we do is guided by our Values.
Courage: Dare to take a risk
Human: Clear, fair & inclusive
Ownership: Passionate, commercial & accountable
Integrity: Do the right thing, however hard
Connected: Together, build something better
 What Hiscox USA Offers
Competitive salary and bonus (based on personal & company performance)
Comprehensive health insurance, Vision, Dental and FSA
401(k) with competitive company matching
24 Paid time off days
10 Paid Holidays
Paid sabbaticals after 10 years of service
Dynamic, creative and values-driven culture
Modern and open office spaces, complimentary fruit and drinks
Spirit of volunteerism, social responsibility and community involvement, including matching charitable donations for qualifying non-profits via our sister non-profit company, the Hiscox USA Foundation
About Hiscox
As an international specialist insurer we are far removed from the world of mass market insurance products. Instead we are selective and focus on our key areas of expertise and strength - all of which is underpinned by a culture that encourages us to challenge convention and always look for a better way of doing things.
We insure the unique and the interesting. And we search for the same when it comes to talented people. Hiscox is full of smart, reliable human beings that look out for customers and each other. We believe in doing the right thing, making good and rebuilding when things go wrong. Everyone is encouraged to think creatively, challenge the status quo and look for solutions.
Scratch beneath the surface and you will find a business that is solid, but slightly contrary. We like to do things differently and constantly seek to evolve. We might have been around for a long time (our roots go back to 1901), but we are young in many ways, ambitious and going places. Some people might say insurance is dull, but life at Hiscox is anything but. If that sounds good to you, get in touch.
About Hiscox US
Hiscox USA was established in 2006 to focus primarily on the needs of small and middle market commercial clients, via both the broker and direct distribution channels and is today the fastest-growing business unit within the Hiscox Group.
Today, Hiscox USA has a talent force of about 420 employees mostly operating out of 6 major cities - New York, Atlanta, Dallas, Chicago, Los Angeles and San Francisco. Hiscox USA offers a broad portfolio of commercial products, including technology, cyber & data risk, multiple professional liability lines, media, entertainment, management liability, crime, kidnap & ransom, commercial property and terrorism.
Diversity and flexible working at Hiscox
At Hiscox we care about our people. We hire the best people for the job and we’re committed to diversity and creating a truly inclusive culture, which we believe drives success. We have also learned through our experience in 2020 that working life doesn’t always have to in the office, and when it’s safe to do so, we will be introducing a more flexible way of working to encourage a healthy work life balance. We see it as the best of both worlds: structure and sociability on one hand, and independence and flexibility on the other.
You can follow Hiscox on LinkedIn, Glassdoor and Instagram (@HiscoxInsurance)

About the position:
TJFACT is seeking a Data Analyst to support the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)!
The Data Analyst will aid in cleaning, analyzing and visualizing large sets of various data to improve the CDC's ability to effectively respond to the COVID-19 pandemic and provide critical insights to federal, state and local public health stakeholders. This is a unique opportunity to leverage academic and professional experience in research, statistics and data analytics to assist with the federal government's response to the most significant global public health challenge in the last century.
Contract Length: 1 year – Full-Time Hours (M-F)
Start Date: End of April 2021 – official start date TBD
Remote opportunity, but highly preferred if candidates are local to the following areas: Atlanta, GA/Denver, CO/San Francisco, CA/Chicago, IL/New York/Seattle, WA/Kansas City, MO/Dallas, TX/Boston, MA/Washington, D.C.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Support data collection, integration, storage, access, analysis, and retention requirements based on the surveillance data collected - Organize and analyze data to be used in briefings, speeches, lectures, meetings, or other presentations by CDC Senior Leadership and Public Health Communications team members.
Perform data science work that requires application of data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and assist with building high-quality prediction systems integrated with public health surveillance systems and programs at the local, state and national levels.
Identify relevant data available, including internal and external data sources, leveraging new data collection processes.
Identify the business requirements and the expected outcome.
Suggest data science tools, methods, and statistical learning models of interest.
Collaborate with other data analysts to ensure that the information used follows the compliance, access management, and control policies.
Present and depict rationale findings in layman’s terms.
Present results that affirm and contradict common assertions or beliefs.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Master’s degree in any of the following fields/area of focus: biology, laboratory sciences, public health, health administration, medical logistics or any other related field.
Minimum of 3-5 years of data analysis experience, and highly preferable if this experience is primarily within the healthcare/public health field
Demonstrated experience and proficiency with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI and Tableau
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Must be a self-starter and comfortable working in a completely remote capacity
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Previous experience working for the CDC
Exposure to statistical analysis software such as SPSS and SAS preferred
Experience leveraging Python and R to aid in statistical analysis also preferred
BENEFITS:
TJFACT is proud to offer industry leading compensation, high-quality, broad and diverse benefits, a very generous Paid Time Off plan, Employee Awards & Rewards, and a corporate 401k plan.
TJFACT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability. EOE/Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran. We reserve the right to modify or revise the job descriptions in part or in its entirety. Reasonable accommodations will be made in accordance with governing law.

At Parametric, we offer competitive salaries, generous benefits and opportunities for growth and development. We invite you to explore our available job opportunities listed below and look forward to having you become a part of our continued success!
General Description
The Data Operations Analyst works within the Investment Operations Department as a subject matter expert in market data, its application and the various business rules that govern it to ensure our business runs smoothly. This person is responsible for daily processes around ensuring accurate market data (specifically pricing, security data, benchmark data), investigates data anomalies through various technologies and tools, and ensures accurate data is consumed into systems.
In addition, this role will be an integral part of the team that oversees and coordinates the collaborative effort across the firm around data governance. With the ultimate goal of centralized, single source data, this role will have the opportunity to help drive business needs and work with SMEs to research and define policies and procedures relevant to the firm’s data strategy.
The successful candidate has great communication, solid analytics, high curiosity, and strong attention to detail. This role works closely with the Investment Operations department staff, Portfolio Managers, Information Technology and other teams. The Data Operations team has staff in Seattle and Minneapolis.
Primary Responsibilities
Responsible for daily processes around market and reference data to ensure accuracy, resolve exceptions, manage data validation
Work closely with SMEs across the firm to research and understand how data is consumed across systems, assist in making recommendations on data policy and document agreed upon decisions.
Responsible for daily processes around Pricing and Security Information/Maintenance in portfolio accounting systems
Extensive knowledge and understanding of the financial services industry and its unique data requirements
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy
Communicate effectively - both verbally and written - to peers and business partners to include strong questioning and listening skills and the ability to look beyond obvious answers to understand impacts
Must thrive in managing multiple deadlines and inquiries across several teams and departments in a fast-paced environment
Resolves issues quickly with a sense of urgency.
Must be able to prioritize
Communicates clearly and effectively with other managers and internal staff
Must be able to self-manage daily and monthly deadlines
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree required
2+ years’ of experience, preferably in financial or asset management related field
Insatiable curiosity, self-starter, and detailed focus
Natural aptitude for technology and data driven initiatives
Ability to self-start
Passionate about financial services, data
Ability to work independently in a high volume, fast-paced environment with strict deadlines
Learn quickly and work in a changing environment
Competent in Microsoft Office programs
Strong Interpersonal and communication Skills
Strong attention to detail
Markit EDM and/or Advent products experience preferred
Experience with Bloomberg and FactSet preferred

description: Overview: Americold provides temperature-controlled warehousing and transportation to food producers, restaurants, schools, and retail outlets such as grocery stores. We're proud to provide an essential link in the food industry supply chain and to help put food on tables around the world.Based in Atlanta, Georgia, Americold owns and operates temperature-controlled warehouses around the world. We have over 16,000 associates and offer a wide variety of career opportunities - from warehouse forklift operators and supervisors to accounting, administration, business development, customer support, engineering, transportation, and technology solutions positions.Responsibilities: Primary Responsibility:The Business Systems Analyst – i3PL position works primarily on Americold’s industry leading i3PL web portal which provides customers and facilities visibility and reporting tools and alerts. This position conducts analysis, design, and testing and also works with the team to set the vision and roadmap for i3PL. This position primarily works on Americold’s i3PL web application but also may work with JDA applications and on other Americold applications and integrations as required. The Systems Analyst works closely with other Operational and IT resources including the Configuration, Training & Support, EDI, Development and Architecture team.Essential Functions:1. Work closely with Operations, Configuration, Training & Support, Project Managers, EDI, Development and other internal and external customers in support of i3PL, WMS and other applications2. Work with Operational, Customer and IT resources to gather requirements.3. Analyze requirements and determine the best, most logical and efficient approach for software design.4. Create detailed functional specification documents for software development.5. Create detailed test plans for UAT and Regression level testing for software changes, application implementation testing and integration testing as necessary.6. Execute test plans and record and communicate issues to Configuration, Development, Architecture, EDI and Project Managers as necessary.7. Provide internal and external demonstrations as needed.8. Help set vision and roadmap for i3PL development and enhancement.9. Provide 1st level support for issues related to Americold applications, investigate and resolve issues directly for the facilities or provide detailed information to 2nd level support team when necessary.10. Determine the root cause of defects to prevent recurrence of the issues and quality problems. The Systems Analyst uses data collected from inspections and testing procedures to determine the cause of quality issues and provide solutions that are defect free.11. Creation and maintenance of up-to-date documentation pertaining to core IT processes, software and business logic, software configuration as well as identification of hardware and infrastructure used to support.12. Document system changes as they are released to production (Change Awareness). Supply knowledge and/or training as applicable to roll-out changes across applicable sites.13. May need to provide after-hours 1st level support.14. Other duties as requestedQualifications: Minimum Qualifications/Additional Skills:1-3 years of experience in technical fields; or equivalent combination of education and experience.1-3 years of experience with implementing, configuring, troubleshooting, and maintaining ERP software applications functionality such as web portals, WMS, Distribution, Transportation, and Labor Management.Experience with online web applications is a must.RedPrairie WMS and WFM is a plus.Needs to be a first-class problem solver – Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.Experience in PL SQL and .NET is a benefit.Knowledge of any reporting engines would be a benefit (Microsoft Reporting Services, Crystal or Jasper)Knowledge of transportation and warehouse industries is a plus.Familiar with quality assurance principles, inspection techniques and testing proceduresStrong communications skills (written/verbal), with emphasis on demonstrated ability to translate complex concepts between business and technical groups.Strong customer service orientation.25% travel to assist with system implementations, may be requiredPhysical Requirements:While performing the essential functions of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; hear or talk: use close vision; use hands to grasp, handle or feel objects; and type and manipulate controls. Employee is occasionally required to use distance vision, stand, kneel or crouch and lift up to 10 lbs.Level of Expertise:LEVEL I: Performs work under general supervision of Director, WMS/WFM Applications or more experienced business systems analysts. Maintains an associate-level workload.LEVEL II: Performs work under minimal supervision for small to medium-sized projects. May require more supervision for larger, more complex projects. Maintains an intermediate-level workload.LEVEL III: Performs work with little to no supervision – provides guidance to lower-level & less experienced developers. Acts as project leader on large, complex projects. Maintains a senior-level workload. Fully capable of working at the highest technical level.Job Type: Full-timePay: Up to $80,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceEmployee assistance programEmployee discountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offReferral programRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:Forest Park, GA 30297: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)Application Question(s):Briefly tell us about your background/experience as a Business Analyst.Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Business Analyst: 3 years (Preferred)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:NoWork Location: One location

Responsibilities Leads and manages requirements gathering and analysis activities by working with internal client stakeholders, developers, designers, QA analysts, etc.Qualifications Solid understanding of software development lifecycle.Work in a fast environment with dynamically changing priorities.Proven experience creating functional and non-functional business requirements.Strong business requirement analytical skills with the ability to produce clearly articulated requirements and documents.Strong understanding of end-to-end cross-functional software development.Demonstrated interpersonal and leadership skills required to interact with staff, colleagues, management and internal/external customers.Attention to details to include ability to follow written and verbal directions and error free written communicationManage multiple projects and priorities, tasks and coordinate various channels of communication.Ability to facilitate and conduct meetings while asking questions and soliciting feedback, presenting and capturing notes/requirements in various software applications / toolsBe proactive and take initiative with little or vague directions at times to include desire to solve problems and be resourceful in seeking answersConduct at a high level of professionalism to include characteristics that exemplify core values and align with the team mission statement.Contract length: 4 monthsJob Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $45.00 - $50.00 per hourSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:Business analysis: 8 years (Required)SDLC: 8 years (Required)Requirements gathering: 8 years (Required)Telecommunication: 8 years (Required)

Fluidra is seeking a Sr Data Analyst to join our team in Newnan, GA
WHY WORK FOR FLUIDRA CMP?
CMP is a leader in products for the recreational pool and spa industry. Innovative products from CMP include sanitizer systems, white goods, LED lighting, water features and accessories. CMP is committed to creating solutions for pool and spa industry professionals. Spa designers, pool builders, bath manufacturers and retail store owners around the world depend on CMP products, service and support. Following a recent acquisition by Fluidra, CMP now is part of a leader in the global pool industry.
We are guided by clear values and come to work every day with a simple and direct mission in mind: To create the perfect pool and wellness experience. By staying focused on this mission, we will create value for all our stakeholders–customers, pool owners, investors and employees.
Fluidra is headquartered in Carlsbad, CA and the business’s other facilities are in Salt Lake City, Utah (Cover-Pools®), Corona, CA, Newnan, GA, Florida and Ontario, Canada.
WHAT YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE
The Sr. Data Analyst is responsible for creating and maintaining data files contained in a computerized database management system (DBMS). This position will gather, analyze, report, and verify the integrity of data in use within multiple business units. This individual will play a crucial role in implementing and recommending procedures to improve business systems, data processing, data flow, collection, and database integrity.
Additionally, you will:
Maintaining the data warehouse and responsible for identifying and revising reporting requirements.Managing and designing the Analytics reporting, including data sources, security, and metadata.Preparing ad-hoc reports to key stakeholders that effectively communicate trends and patterns using relevant data.Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.Ability to understand business concepts and translate non-technical requirements from various stakeholders into technical terms.Understanding of databases, ETL tools, and best practices in creating and delivering useful information.Provide end-user support and troubleshooting for issues related to ERP system, including writing and running reports to query data from Epicor (ERP) and analyze as needed.Establish, coordinate, and maintain data integrity procedures, processes, and policies that efficiently enhance data integrity.Work with end-users to identify and analyze business processes, workflows, requirements, issues, and opportunities, and evaluate the potential application of new or modified technology solutions and/or processesAssist in Beta Test releases, updates, and enhancements to new and existing business systems and assist' in the coordination of user sign-off and roll-outTroubleshoot end user reported problems or coordinate internal and/or external support if necessaryMaintain confidentiality with regard to the information being processed, stored, or accessed by
the network.Other duties as assigned.
WHAT WE SEEK
Experience working with Power BI is a must.Experience working on ERP systems (preferably Epicor).Design, develop and maintain reports SkillsStrong oral and written communication skills
Effective interpersonal skillsSkilled in standard industry tools and practices
EDUCATION B.S. in Computer Science or Management Information Systems required. 2-3 years of Data Analyst/Database management experience and on tools like Power BI/Tableau.
 Knowledge of ERP, MS SQL, SSIS, SSRS, Visual Studio. Knowledge of C# and Angular JS is a plus.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

While performing the duties of this job, employees are regularly required to read and write, sit, walk within the facility to access file cabinets, documents, stand; talk or hear, both in person and by telephone; use hands repetitively to finger, handle, feel or operate standard office equipment; reach with hands and arms; and lift up to 10 pounds. They also occasionally move objects weighing up to 20 lbs., and sometimes, but rarely, up to 50 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and the ability to adjust focus.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this position. Employees work under typical office conditions, and the noise level is usually quiet.
In the pursuit of product excellence, Fluidra takes its corporate values to heart. We implement these guiding principles in everything we do: passion for success, honesty & trust, customer collaboration, team work, learn and adapt, excellence and Innovation.
For a deeper dive into our corporate culture, click here.

description:
Thank you for your interest in a career at Regions. At Regions, we believe associates deserve more than just a job. We believe in offering performance-driven individuals a place where they can build a career --- a place to expect more opportunities. If you are focused on results, dedicated to quality, strength and integrity, and possess the drive to succeed, then we are your employer of choice.

Regions is dedicated to taking appropriate steps to safeguard and protect private and personally identifiable information you submit. The information that you submit will be collected and reviewed by associates, consultants, and vendors of Regions in order to evaluate your qualifications and experience for job opportunities and will not be used for marketing purposes, sold, or shared outside of Regions unless required by law. Such information will be stored in accordance with regulatory requirements and in conjunction with Regions’ Retention Schedule for a minimum of three years. Job Description:
At Regions, the Risk Information Technology (RIT) Analyst is a key member of the Innovation and IT Risk Management organization and perform activities consistent with the second line of defense. This position will influence enterprise innovation and conduct IT risk identification, measurement, mitigation, monitoring, and reporting activities in accordance with the enterprise strategy and enterprise risk appetite.

Primary Responsibilities
Assists in conducting key tasks and/or projects to perform IT Risk Assessments, IT Advisory Reviews, IT Project Assessments, 3rd Party IT Testing, and other project reviews as identified across all aspects of Information Technology, including application development, cyber security, enterprise architecture, business continuity and disaster recovery, and change management
Remains abreast of innovative business and technology trends in IT security, risk, and controls and advise leadership on technology initiatives that support these trends
Manages relationships with key stakeholders within strategic business groups and technology to ensure effective execution of the risk management framework
Performs deep dives on IT security-related processes and systems
Identifies applicable regulatory risks from changes or releases to regulatory guidance and requirements and provide subject matter expertise for resolution and risk mitigation
Manages targeted reviews of internal risk and control assessments on current and/or emerging IT risks
Develops, tracks, and reports on Key Risk Indicators (KRI’s) for Information Technology
Monitors, tracks, and reports mitigation and resolution of IT risk issues
Develops and manages reporting to effectively communicate key risks, findings, and recommendations for improvement and discuss results with key stakeholders

This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not eligible for overtime pay.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in related field
Four (4) years of experience in IT, system development, and information security
Understanding of risk management functions, including IT audit, cyber security, and compliance

Preferences
Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)
Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC)
Experience in a financial institution or public accounting
Knowledge of third-party/vendor management lifecycle

Skills and Competencies
Ability to learn additional systems as needed
Ability to research, analyze data, and derive facts
Ability to work in a team environment when applicable
Ability to work under moderate guidance
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)
Strong verbal, written communication, and organizational skills
Strong work ethic and self-motivation
Additional Preferences for this specific opportunity
CISA
CRISC
CISSP


This position may be filled at a higher level depending on the candidate's qualifications and relevant experience.

Position Type Full time

Position Summary
We are an interactive agency looking for a full-time Data Analytics Strategist. Our Analytics team works end to end with marketing data from setting up proper data collection to creating forecasts and implementing data models. The team is integrated with marketing strategy, keeping the client’s larger needs in mind at each step. We are looking for someone with experience in marketing data who understands the importance of logical data schemas and has the ability to implement them.
The right person will have experience with best practices in campaign tracking (LinkedIn, Ads, Bing, FB) and website tagging (GTM, Adobe) with a full understanding of how a logical schema is crucial to data analysis. Experience in development (JS, data layer implementation) and/or marketing data analysis (Alteryx, dashboarding) a plus. You’ll be using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, web browser development tools, and related technologies on a daily basis for reporting.
Applicants need to be able to communicate and collaborate well within internal teams as well as with external stakeholders. Minimum 5 years of experience working with web analytics and marketing data preferred. Google Analytics and/or Google 360 certification is a requirement for this position.
This position is currently remote optional with a preference towards candidates located in the Atlanta, GA area.

We are proud to offer our clients a full team of search specialists, social media managers, web developers, content creators, Facebook fanatics and brilliant web geeks. We do not outsource our projects: 100% of our work is done in-house. Our clients have access to our team throughout the whole process, and our marketing and web development teams work hand-in-hand to create smart, deliberate out-of-the-box solutions.
We love our people and our people are some of the most creative and goal-oriented individuals around. Our company is a motivating and supportive environment. We’re constantly looking for interesting, intelligent, and creative people to join us.

1st shift but will require to on call

Qualifications : BACHELOR OF COMPUTER SCIENCE

Smart Space was created primarily to offer real solutions to the growing worldwide environmental crisis emerging from carbon emissions. Commercial and residential buildings account for the majority of the total carbon footprint of cities around the world. New buildings are built with this in mind, so the real key to substantial progress is reducing existing building energy consumption and carbon outputs. Smart Space is dedicated to retrofitting residential and commercial buildings to reduce energy waste, improve indoor air quality, while optimizing a return in the investment for clients. Using the most current technologies, diagnostic tools, and principals of building science, we are passionate about the whole building approach with the understanding that a space performs optimally as a integrated whole. We are a full service company that offers a complete range of products and services to improve the comfort, health, and efficiency of spaces.
We see our Building Analyst and Sales Technician as a source of our competitive advantage. Smart Space looks for people who are eager to bring skills, knowledge, and passion to an integrated team. As we work towards scaling our growth while maintaining the quality of our services, we are hiring a dedicated Building Analyst/Sales Technician who will have three key areas of responsibilities: (1) gathering and analyzing data, (2) learning and acquiring new skills in the continually evolving field of building science and sustainable retrofitting, and (3) educating our customers about the most effective strategies to improve comfort and indoor air quality, reduce energy waste, and save money.
Roles and Responsibilities
Establish an initial relationship with customers and communicate the scope of work (initial and post Smart Space BPI Home or Commercial Energy Assessment, sitting down to discuss reports generated, and filing of rebate applications etc)
Collect and analyze data of buildings using diagnostic tools (blower door, duct blaster, pressure pan tests, infrared camera imaging, safety testing, etc) with a keen eye towards quality control, detail, and mitigating risk
Select and manage tools, materials, equipment, and track inventory
Identify any health and safety issues related for retrofitting projects
Inspect and analyze building envelope, mechanical systems, electrical systems, or process systems to determine the energy consumption of each system
Analyze technical feasibility of energy savings measures using knowledge of engineering, energy productions, energy use, construction costs, maintenance, system operation, or process system.
Generate software reports based on gathered data
Educate residential customers based on date gathered, software modeling, and principals of building science on the most effective retrofit projects to reduce energy waste, improve indoor air quality and comfort.
Negotiate terms of agreements and draft contracts
Prepare internal and external reports pertaining to job status
Proven working experience in related fields
Able to articulate a broad knowledge of and passion for building science and the field of sustainable retrofitting in a thoughtful, concise, and professional manner
Expert knowledge of building products, construction details, relevant rules, regulations, and quality standards
Familiarity with software modeling programs for retrofitting
Qualifications
Proven working experience in related fields
Able to articulate a broad knowledge of and passion for building science and the field of sustainable retrofitting in a thoughtful, concise, and professional manner
Expert knowledge of building products, construction details, relevant rules, regulations, and quality standards
Familiarity with software modeling programs for retrofitting

Required Skills
Outstanding communication, relationship, and collaboration skills
Resourcefulness in the ability to achieve results in the most effective manner
Excellent organization and time management skills, including the ability to work within strict deadlines
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Comfortable in wearing multiple hats when necessary to get the job done
Communicate and align strategy with key internal and external stakeholders
Eager to learn and acquire new skills and knowledge as the field evolves and changes

positionName: Senior Business Data Analyst - Channel Management
description:
Company Description
SquareTrade is the fastest growing company of its kind. We’re revolutionizing a $30b industry with service innovation and attention to customer satisfaction. We partner with some of the largest, most sophisticated retailers and carriers in the world (Amazon, Walmart, The Home Depot to name a few), consistently win industry awards, have received tens of thousands of 5-star reviews… and we’re just getting started. A member of the Allstate family, SquareTrade has headquarters in San Francisco and London. We are currently expanding in Europe and Asia Pacific, including Japan and Australia.

Job Description
As a Senior Business Data Analyst on our Channel Management Team, you will play a pivotal role in managing and manipulating data to identifying trends. This work is the backbone to how our collective team identifies, prioritizes, and sells growth strategies to our retail partners. You will take an end-to-end view of business operations and finance, requiring expertise with SQL and Tableau, strong data analytics, business intelligence, project management and financial planning capabilities. You will partner with cross-functional teams in the design, planning, implementation, and data analysis of business enhancement for ecommerce, retail and B2B sales channels.
This position reports to the Vice President, Partner Strategy and provides opportunities to work on challenging projects in close collaboration with virtually every team in the company.
Responsibilities:
Data Analysis: Uncovering new opportunities to optimize and grow the business through data driven insights. Exploring causes or trends to identify problems and developing action plans to address those opportunities. Inform and influence business decisions at client senior management levels through detailed product and sales analysis.
Project Management: Developing and owning project plans and stakeholder engagements for various channel initiatives. Tracking project performance, proactively addressing potential risks and communicating updates to all stakeholders in a timely manner.
Financial Planning: Ensuring annual growth targets are tracked and achieved through, strategic and near-term tactical planning and execution. Using sales data to create tactical action plans and long term business plans. Driving aspects of business segment planning, including internal alignment from the top down, and external alignment with key client leaders.
Reporting: Intensely tracking sales results on a weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual basis. Improving efficiency through the use of automation tools to make information available on an ongoing and real-time basis. Providing summary level trends on a regular basis and detailed trend analysis when necessary.
Field Marketing and Communication: Creating and managing annual marketing plans inclusive of training schedule, incentive contests, POP marketing materials, product fairs, e-learning, etc in partnership with the Channel Marketing and Field teams. Managing activities within budget, proactively communicating with all stakeholders and evaluating ROI of all initiatives.

Qualifications

Expertise with SQL, databases, reporting tools (Tableau) and large data volumes is a must
2-4 years of work experience as a business analyst, data analyst, or similar position
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Ability to draw conclusions from raw data then summarize results quickly and efficiently
Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Proactive, organized and detail oriented
Analytical with strong writing and presentation skills
Experience working for or with national retailers is a major plus
Additional Information
Some of the benefits of working @Squaretrade include:
Competitive salaries, benefits (medical, dental, vision), flex PTO, 401k matching, paid parental leave
$80 per month connectivity reimbursement directly in your paycheck
Respect for your work-life balance
A paid volunteer day to give back to the community
Flexible work schedules - some roles are hybrid allowing you to work from home a few days per week

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Overview of the Position:
The Data Analyst will join the data science team embedded within the Technology Enabled Services organization. The team member will assist in the creation of data driven solutions to business problems including data consolidation and normalization, generation of actionable business insight, building advanced analytical models, and partnering with operations and overhead partners for feedback and user acceptance. The position will receive a business-driven problem, gather and cleanse data, build complex and automated models, draw key insights from the data, and ultimately deliver interventional tools to drive savings to the bottom line. The ideal candidate for this role has a propensity for data mining, project management, and can draw insights from analytics to improve and develop measurable interventions.
What will be my duties and responsibilities in his job?
Collects, cleanses, and automates data flows into a central repository
Analyzes existing data sets to identify patterns, outliers, and areas of inconsistencies through relationships that exist in the data
Collaborates with business leaders to validate data insights, and design strategies or recommend changes
Builds models for automated data analysis and predictive insights
Creates data visualizations for end users including the use of dashboards (Power BI) or user interfaces (PowerApps or other web-based interface)
Facilitates cross-functional teams and uses an inclusive approach to understanding current operations
Demonstrate good judgment and analytical skills to conduct option analysis and present recommendations
What are the requirements needed for this position?
BA or BS degree in a quantitative discipline such as Management Information Systems, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or Computer Science
2-4 years of applicable work experience preferably in analytics, data science, business intelligence, or similar field.
Strong personal computer literacy required including working knowledge of relevant software packages such as Microsoft Excel, statistics packages (Python or R), and data visualization suites (Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau, etc.)
Ability to work with large amounts of data, including checks for integrity, summation, and effective communication (written and verbal) to internal and external constituents
Experience with SQL is required.
What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?
Healthcare background is preferred
Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrated ability to manage indirect teams, including members who may be senior in rank
Demonstrated capacity to become “expert” in new topics and disciplines quickly
“Self-starter” attitude with the ability to excel in dynamic work environments
Comfort with problem solving frameworks, root cause analysis, hypothesis testing, and translation of insights into business impact
Ability to manage multiple priorities
How much will I be expected to travel in this position?
Very limited travel required (possibly 1-2 times per year).

At Kids2, we’re really good at what we do. And when we’re great at our jobs, we help parents be great at their jobs.
Parenting is demanding, and that’s where we come in. We want to reimagine how brands can make it easier for early stage parents – not by just selling them products, but by providing holistic solutions that transcend borders, categories and aisles.
No matter our title or department, at Kids2, our job is to create more tiny wins for parents, so they can create bright futures for their little ones. That’s a big task!

Provide Ad-hoc support and analysis as needed

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Experience and demonstrated ability to analyze data and make appropriate recommendations
Analytics: Business and marketplace
Advanced Excel experience with pivot tables, graphs, and reporting

4-year college degree in business, engineering, or related field
Plans and manages effectively
Critical thinking and problem solving
Focuses on the customer
Communication: Internal and external
Excellent communication skills and working with cross functional groups and customer
Ability to consult with account teams and proactively identify appropriate
Communicate and work collaboratively internally and customer
Demonstrated ability to work independently
Service oriented
Learning agility
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
None required.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Your innovation. Our impact. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater health for our communities, and greater experiences for our customers.
