Senior Analyst, Data and Finance
**Position may be located within 50 miles of any Anthem Office**
As a Senior Analyst, Data and Finance, you’ll help shape the team’s portfolio and direction by applying financial and data analysis knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to directly influence the success of solutions and services that are transforming healthcare. You will work cross functionally across Innovation, engaging with every program and project to gather, inform, track, and refine their strategies, budgets, resources, as well as calculate and track ROI to ensure their success.
This is an execution focused role for someone who is skilled in aspects of data and financial analysis including areas such as statistical analysis, ROI analysis, forecasting, and managing complex datasets. Key to your success will be grit, the ability to navigate the complexities of a large organization, and a relentless drive to see solutions scale across the enterprise. You will be looked to as a trusted partner and problem solver, determinedly helping all stakeholders overcome obstacles and guiding solutions forward.
Responsibilities:
Own critical comprehensive analysis functions using statistical and financial techniques to create and manipulate complex datasets to identify trends, issues, opportunities, and anomalies, develop business cases, performance reports, financial statements, budgets, forecasts, and internal management reports.
Identify resource, risk, quality, cost, ROI, and develop program/project tracking plans in partnership with initiative leaders to scale high value, technology-enabled solutions and services from MVP through deployment at scale.
Conduct and document complex financial and business-related analysis and translate them into periodic and ad hoc reports, using numbers to present fact-based narratives and enable data-driven decision making.
Adept at managing timelines, presenting and communicating progress to executive teams.
Establish and maintain collaborative relationships to drive results.
Prioritize and execute multiple major projects/programs with broad scope and strategic business impact with minimal oversight.
Work collaboratively across a matrixed, cross-functional structure, and collaborate with a high-performance team.
Track outcomes and manage activities and program performance in accordance with budget and strategic direction.

Skills needed to thrive in this role:
Relentless focus on execution. Strong record of business, financial, and/or data analysis of complex, high-value technology-enabled solutions, ideally in the healthcare, insurance, financial, or technology sectors.
Skilled at presenting the results of complex statistical and financial modeling through data visualization in table and graphic format.
Excellent communication with an eye for detail, an ear for important items, and a focus on the concise and accurate analysis and presentation of data across emails, spreadsheets, presentations, meetings, and reports.
Strategic mindset and the ability to see and act within the bigger picture while connecting dots and finding opportunities for collaboration.
Skillful at building consensus and making thoughtful, data-driven recommendations for project / program prioritization, solution design, issue management, risk identification and mitigation
Excellent business judgment and a practical, common-sense approach to getting things done
Cross-functional communication to ensure all technical and non-technical. stakeholders can collaborate effectively and stay engaged throughout the lifecycle of a project
A “radar” for identifying when you or a struggling project needs additional guidance from leadership and being able to escalate it appropriately.
Ability to effectively collaborate and win the respect of your peers and stakeholders.

Qualifications
Minimum Requirements:
Requires an BA/BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field of study and a minimum of 5 years overall; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
3+ years of experience in driving data analysis, financial planning, statistical analysis.

Preferred Qualifications:
Demonstrated results with progressively increasing responsibilities and proven ability to manage multiple tasks, projects, and work with a geographically distributed team.
High proficiency in MS Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and familiarity with statistical/financial tools and modeling.

As an associate in the Business Intelligence Consulting practice at RSM, you will work with various sized businesses in diverse industries and receive hands-on client experience. This is a client-facing role and you will be responsible for providing the highest level of operational support to RSM clients and the RSM engagement teams serving those clients. They will be a problem solver, creative thinker, fast learner, be detail oriented and interested in learning new technology.

Executing solution delivery engagements

Collaborating and working effectively with consultants in other regions and practices

You want your next step to be the right one. You've worked hard to get where you are today. And now you're ready to use your unique skills, talents and personality to achieve great things. RSM is a place where you are valued as an individual, mentored as a future leader, and recognized for your accomplishments and potential. Working directly with clients, key decision makers and business owners across various industries and geographies, you'll move quickly along the learning curve and our clients will benefit from your fresh perspective.

Experience RSM US. Experience the power of being understood.

RSM is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans.

Build your future with Sovos.

Digital technology has forever changed business. Now, it’s transforming tax. Sovos software was built for the digital future of tax, with complete, connected offerings for tax determination, continuous transaction control compliance, tax reporting and more. Sovos supports more than 16,000 customers, including half of the Fortune 500, operating in over 70 countries. Our SaaS products and proprietary Sovos S1 Platform integrate with a wide variety of business applications and government compliance processes. Our 2,000+ employees throughout the Americas and Europe are building the future of global compliance software with a culture of commitment to keep our promise to customers.

The Work You’ll Do:

The Indirect Tax Analyst will play a key role supporting the global tax function by providing guidance to different departments at all levels within the organization, overseeing the indirect tax return process, implementing process efficiencies, and interacting with various consultants and tax auditors.
More specifically you will:

Prepare, extract, and analyze data to support indirect tax compliance calculations.
Serve as a technical resource, including review of select filings and forms; registrations and compliance in appropriate taxing jurisdictions; and financial impact of new and proposed tax legislation.
Develop, document and implement process improvements across all indirect tax reporting functions, including refinements to current processes and work-papers, as well as utilizing technology to improve and enhance workflow.
Analyze and reconcile sales tax receivable and liability accounts as assigned in a timely, accurate and efficient manner; recommend appropriate adjustments to those accounts and otherwise ensure assigned accounts are accurate.
Review and analyze use tax accruals, monitor available tax credits for returns, and evaluate billing and new product setup.
Support audits by managing data extracts requested by auditors, answering questions, analyzing findings, and implementing corrective action where necessary.
Assist with the integration of acquisitions including remediation of tax exposures.
Oversee the maintenance of the company’s Exemption Certificate Management system and related compliance.
Provide best practices and training to colleagues to enhance processes.
Design and support a system of internal controls with respect to Sales & Use and other Indirect Taxes. Maintain an indirect global tax calendar.
Serve as a principal point of contact for Indirect Tax related questions.
Assist with VAT, property tax, W-9s, and other projects as requested

What we need from you:

Experience with indirect tax in public accounting or a tax department
Proficient in Excel - ability to create large workbooks, build formulas and pivot tables
Strong analytical, technical, written and communication skills. Strives for continuous improvement
Ability to lead and prioritize multiple assignments and projects; resolve complex tax issues; deliver a thorough and accurate work product in a dynamic environment
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and interact effectively with teammates and colleagues
Tax automation and implementation experience a plus
Due to federal contracts with clients of ours – successful candidates will be asked to clear a background check and drug test upon hire

What Does Sovos Offer You?

The tools to grow your career both personally and professionally:

Did you know that over 30% of our employees earned a promotion or job change In FY2020? That can happen because growth Is serious business here at Sovos, and we have the programs in place to make sure of it, including:

Mentoring Programs
Management Bootcamps and Development Trainings
Yearly performance reviews where compensation and performance are assessed and rewarded generously
Clear paths for growth within our roles (but we know that career development can be like a spider web, not a ladder - we give you the tools to move outside of your career as well!)

The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work

MyTime flexible time off (no worrying about accruing time or running out of sick days - If you need time off, take It!)
Paid family leave
Tuition reimbursement
Generous 401k match
Company seeded and matched Health Savings Account

Are you worried that you don’t check all of the boxes? Apply anyway! There are no perfect candidates - we hire people, not resumes. We are excited that you’re here and we look forward to taking a look at your application to determine next steps.

Sovos is an equal opportunity employer and those seeking employment with us are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job description:
What is the role?
Hiscox USA is currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst Lead to work closely with the business in the primary role of orchestrating visibility and prioritization of business change so that we maximize the value of resource investments to deliver the agreed business plan. The Senior Business Analyst mainly supports larger/medium sized projects by documenting business needs and requirements. Critical thinking, good communication, and initiative are essential in this high-pressure environment of rapid change. This role will report directly to the Broker Portfolio Change Manager and is based in Atlanta.
Examples of duties and responsibilities
Works independently to execute business level requirements gathering sessions for larger/medium sized projects and strategic programs with challenging timeframes and deliverables
Has advanced proficiency with gap analysis, solution evaluation, problem solving, issues triaging, and autonomous issue resolution
Works with managers and staff within the Broker, Underwriting Management, and Field portfolio, the PMO, and Hiscox IT to deliver projects
Develops an extensive knowledge of systems, serves as subject matter expert to support portfolio products, and applies this knowledge to summarize the impact of system changes
Conducts process reviews/gap analysis and adds new perspective to produce solutions
Analyzes and decomposes complex requirements
Documents requirements, guides functional specifications, prepares wireframes/flowcharts
Understands and anticipates project objectives, identifies opportunities, and makes recommendations to support the desired future state
Validates the functionality of the end-product according to the requirement specifications
Builds strong productive relationships with the managers and staff within the business, operations team, call center, Hiscox IT, and suppliers/vendors to deliver effective solutions based on a deep understanding of the business drivers for each stakeholder group
Manages scope and risk effectively and clearly communicates with all stakeholders on feasibility and effort analysis
Manages stakeholder expectations and project scope by helping to prioritize change requests
Demonstrates an in-depth knowledge of most products, IT, BI, Claims, and Service Delivery processes to identify and communicate how solutions can support the achievement of short- and long-term business goals
Assists with coordinating user acceptance testing
Manages team of business analysts and is responsible for ensuring on-boarding, training, and mentorship is provided
Establishes guidelines, best practices, and standards for the BA team
Guides and supports professional development goals and initiatives of the business analysts
Develops team goals that support the overall Change organization goals
Serves as the point person for BA team escalations

person specification:
Person specification:
Needs to be an independent thinker, self-starter to be a key contributor to Broker project delivery
Minimum of 6 to 8 years corporate business analyst experience is preferred; Insurance experience is ideal
Minimum of 2 to 3 years of management experience
Bachelor or graduate degree or equivalent work experience in an analytical discipline is required
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and balance across projects
Ability to lead meeting, workshops and presentations
Good understanding of Policy Administration life cycle, insurance workflow is a plus
Expertise in soliciting requirements, and documenting requirements/processes is required
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required
Comfort and experience working with people at all seniority levels is required
Ideal candidate will be creative, proactive, logical and innovative and will not just accept the status quo
Should be highly results driven, with the energy and determination to succeed in a very fast paced environment where the pace of response and leadership is critical to success
Exposure to distributed teams and relationship building with stakeholders who may not be located within the same geographical area
Demonstrate a commitment to quality, service and problem management
Ability to travel up to 20% of time.
Hiscox Values
At Hiscox our spirit is in Challenging Convention and everything we do is guided by our Values.
Courage: Dare to take a risk
Human: Clear, fair & inclusive
Ownership: Passionate, commercial & accountable
Integrity: Do the right thing, however hard
Connected: Together, build something better
 What Hiscox USA Offers
Competitive salary and bonus (based on personal & company performance)
Comprehensive health insurance, Vision, Dental and FSA
401(k) with competitive company matching
24 Paid time off days
10 Paid Holidays
Paid sabbaticals after 10 years of service
Dynamic, creative and values-driven culture
Modern and open office spaces, complimentary fruit and drinks
Spirit of volunteerism, social responsibility and community involvement, including matching charitable donations for qualifying non-profits via our sister non-profit company, the Hiscox USA Foundation
About Hiscox
As an international specialist insurer we are far removed from the world of mass market insurance products. Instead we are selective and focus on our key areas of expertise and strength - all of which is underpinned by a culture that encourages us to challenge convention and always look for a better way of doing things.
We insure the unique and the interesting. And we search for the same when it comes to talented people. Hiscox is full of smart, reliable human beings that look out for customers and each other. We believe in doing the right thing, making good and rebuilding when things go wrong. Everyone is encouraged to think creatively, challenge the status quo and look for solutions.
Scratch beneath the surface and you will find a business that is solid, but slightly contrary. We like to do things differently and constantly seek to evolve. We might have been around for a long time (our roots go back to 1901), but we are young in many ways, ambitious and going places. Some people might say insurance is dull, but life at Hiscox is anything but. If that sounds good to you, get in touch.
About Hiscox US
Hiscox USA was established in 2006 to focus primarily on the needs of small and middle market commercial clients, via both the broker and direct distribution channels and is today the fastest-growing business unit within the Hiscox Group.
Today, Hiscox USA has a talent force of about 420 employees mostly operating out of 6 major cities - New York, Atlanta, Dallas, Chicago, Los Angeles and San Francisco. Hiscox USA offers a broad portfolio of commercial products, including technology, cyber & data risk, multiple professional liability lines, media, entertainment, management liability, crime, kidnap & ransom, commercial property and terrorism.
Diversity and flexible working at Hiscox
At Hiscox we care about our people. We hire the best people for the job and we’re committed to diversity and creating a truly inclusive culture, which we believe drives success. We have also learned through our experience in 2020 that working life doesn’t always have to in the office, and when it’s safe to do so, we will be introducing a more flexible way of working to encourage a healthy work life balance. We see it as the best of both worlds: structure and sociability on one hand, and independence and flexibility on the other.
You can follow Hiscox on LinkedIn, Glassdoor and Instagram (@HiscoxInsurance)

Business Systems Analyst

Are you looking to launch your Information Technology career? If so, then UPS is the place for you!

UPS is now recognized as a technology company spending more than $1 billion a year on information technology. UPS provides its customers unparalleled capability in tracking and distribution intelligence. This technological infrastructure also enables UPS to provide fully integrated Web-enabled, business-to-business solutions.

UPS is embarking in a WFM, Time, and Payroll Transformation project for the purposes to support the end-to-end implementation of a modern Time & Attendance and Payroll solution, operating and service delivery model in North America, and executing a successful end user experience. Our goal is to transform the Payroll function to become more strategic, technology-enabled, and effective organization with strong business alignment, modernized technology, and efficient processes.

UPS is hiring a business analyst role to support the payroll operations team business capabilities and strategies by analyzing complex business processes end-to-end, making design recommendations to optimize performance, and supporting the execution of programs to realize our future-state.

Job Description:

The Business Systems Analyst works independently on projects of moderate to high complexity serves as a liaison between the business community and Information Services (I.S.). This position contributes to the identification of solution alternatives, elicits and develops business and functional requirements that meet the needs of the business in a date driven business and application development environment.

The successful candidate should have 3-5+ years of Business Systems Analysis experience. The candidate should have experience elicting, creating and editing Business and Functional Requirements.

Responsibilities:

Applies Business Systems Analysis Processes

Participates in creating project work plans for assigned tasks to ensure milestones are met.
Supports subject matter experts in specific business systems analysis areas (e.g., business domains, processes, tools, techniques, etc.) while expanding his/her knowledge base.
Reviews other BSA's (Business Systems Analysis) work products to ensure completeness, accuracy, and adherence to quality and work product standards and best practices.
Participates in testing of BSA work products and processes to identify requirements defects, to meet standards, and to ensure effectiveness.
Assists in conducting root cause analysis of defects to identify key and recurring problems, and provides solutions to prevent recurrence.
Assist to define and implement system solutions and execute in an agile delivery model by developing epics, user stories, test scripts, acceptance criteria, and training materials.
Develop time and payroll business process framework.
Analyze existing processes, applying different techniques and methods, including documentation of the existing flows.
Support the design of "to be" processes and work with functional SMEs to stay aligned with business stakeholders, users, and technical teams.

Elicits and Analyzes Business Needs

This position elicits and analyzes business needs for highly complex projects and validates that solutions fit within the long-term strategic vision.
Coordinates and facilitates work sessions to gather relevant information and to ensure understanding of the audience's knowledge.
Analyzes, comprehends, and applies the appropriate level of details, based on the stage of the project life cycle.
Participates in identifying solutions for cross-functional project and ensures mapped solutions satisfy business problems and opportunities.
Develops detailed business and functional requirements, requirements traceability, and corresponding work products to ensure stakeholder understanding and to serve as a basis for subsequent work products in the project life cycle.
Breaks down complex concepts into comprehensible concepts to ensure appropriate level of communication and understanding for the project stakeholders.
Identifies, addresses, negotiates, records, reports, manages and escalates action items, risks and issues associated to the project.

Business Analysis
Business Process Modeling
Microsoft Office

Ability to create project plans

Experience with Quality Management, Change Management, Business Processing

The Online Specialist is responsible for reporting on our web based channels. Must be able to manipulate large amounts of data from disparate sources and ensure accuracy and integrity of numbers.
Experience working with a sales team is a plus.

They will provide support to other technical teams and end-users. The EDI Analyst will also create interfaces with the business to determine requirements, processes and design EDI solutions to meet company needs.
Responsibilities and Essential Functions:
Prepare and maintain data mapping, mailbox, and communication systems.
Analyze EDI data and ensure effective integration of data to interface and application files, while also trading partner mailboxes.
Develop procedures to conduct audits and control procedures.
Create map EDI transaction sets in translation software.
Create and maintain trading partner profiles in translation software.
Develop authentication and encryption system, if necessary.
Collaborate with development project leaders on trading partner-specific technical issues.
Establish and maintain mailboxes with the VAN.
Incorporate audit and control procedures within trading partner profiles, translation set maps, and interface files.
Required cognitive and psychological characteristics:
Be personable, articulate, and knowledgeable.
Ability to learn skills quickly with a mature and service-oriented attitude.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and organizational skills.
Attention to detail and highly motivated.
Ability to manage multiple tasks.
Skilled in presenting, meeting facilitation, negotiation, decision-making, and problem-solving.
Ability to resolve problems quickly and efficiently to minimize business disruption.
Work Environment and Physical Demands:
Must be able to remain in a stationary position more than 75% of the time while operating a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, printer, and/or copy machine.
Frequent reaching, sitting, walking, standing, lifting, stooping, or carrying of equipment and materials may be required.
Must be able to move about the office and position self to access file cabinets, copy machine, etc.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
The employee must frequently lift and move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and move up to 50 pounds of office equipment.
Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.
Required Credentials:
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or a similar field.
2-4 years of experience as an EDI Specialist or equivalent in another field.
Knowledge working in MS D365 F&O is preferred.
Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 ERP is preferred.
Understanding of EDI translation software packages and document standards.
Proficiency in data mapping.
Analytical thinking and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to project manage and work with large teams.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Experience with end-user training of EDI systems.
Competencies
Technical Capacity.
Problem Solving/Analysis
Communication Proficiency
Work Independently or Collaboratively.
Attention to detail

At Delta Dental, our strategy is only as strong as the people who execute it! We are hiring individuals that are not just right for today but also for our future. The Actuarial Analyst is an introductory level job for someone who either has strong potential for or has demonstrated a strong understanding and acumen for actuarial concepts. Some prior professional experience is helpful but not required, so long as potential has been demonstrated through the passing of actuarial examinations. An Actuarial Analyst is expected to be highly self-motived but will require occasional supervision and guidance. This job is responsible for accurately analyzing dental experience and other analysis, including (but not limited to) forecasting, reserving, fee development and financial and client reporting.
How you will make an impact:
Performs comprehensive analysis ranging from client-specific to global (book of business) using experience from datasets of low to moderate size or complexity.
Prepares and presents analysis, reports or documents to support actuarial analysis to internal customers.
Advises and provides guidance on actuarial reporting to internal customers.
Creates reports and analyzes data to identify solutions that meet business goals.
Analyzes current processes and identifies existing or potential problems in order to discover new process improvement opportunities.
Performs other duties as requested or assigned.
What we look for:
A Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, or related field is preferred.
2 years of experience or completion of at least one actuarial examination is required for applicants without relevant work experience.
Strong skills in Excel and SQL knowledge preferred.
Intermediate written and verbal communication skills are required.
Advanced mathematics knowledge is required.
Organizational and time management skills and multi-tasking capabilities are required.
Candidate must be detail-oriented with analytical and problem-solving skills.

12 days starting vacation, 12 holidays, 9 sick days and your birthday off!
Low-cost premium medical insurance options
100% paid dental and vision insurance
Generous 401(k) matching and flat contribution
Social responsibility and volunteer opportunities, including 16 paid volunteer hours annually

Fertility and diabetes benefits

Culture of learning: career development and tuition reimbursement
Career growth: we love promoting from within

job description:
The Role
Hiscox USA is currently searching for an enthusiastic and driven Senior Business Analyst to rigorously ensure accurate requirements management for projects of great importance and high visibility. This role has full accountability for delivery of projects based on the agreed upon scope, on time, and within budget.
The Team
Hiscox USA consists of over 80 IT professionals primary located in Atlanta Georgia with people in satellite offices in New York and India. The US IT Leadership, managed by the Head of IT (USA), consists of Leaders representing Broker Change Delivery, Direct and Partnerships Change Delivery, Operations, Software Delivery, Architecture and Infrastructure. We will be expanding the team in 2017 by circa 26 additional professionals to drive a program of work that will implement a new Policy Administration System.
Key Responsibilities:
Fully responsible for documenting detailed technical requirements and supporting the project manager towards successful project delivery.
Works closely with managers and staff within the US Business and across IT as well with external partners and vendors across a number of geographies (US, UK, India) in order to deliver the project requirements.
Holds requirements gathering sessions, captures meeting minutes, documents clear and concise requirements, follows up on action items, reports project status, and owns project documentation.
Manages scope creep and clearly communicates with business stakeholders on feasibility and effort analysis.
Works closely with the Development and Testing teams throughout the project lifecycle to ensure technical feasibility, requirements are understood, and development is aligned.
Reviews test cases and test plans from the System Test team, negotiates testing scope and timelines, reviews test scripts, reviews defects raised.
Drives the User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with the business users which includes performing some parts of the UAT, provides test scenarios and training to the business users, reviews defects raised.
Maintains risks and issues log and actively manages the mitigation strategies.
Communicates regularly with the project team members, the IT leadership, US Business Stakeholders, and Project Sponsors to provide appropriate requirements related status and clarifications.
Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Key processes

person specification:
Person Specification:
BA/BS Degree
5 to 7 years experience in working as a Technical Business Analyst in an environment of multiple projects with challenging timeframes and deliverables
Experience working with distributed teams and relationship building with stakeholders who are also not located within the same geographical area.
Experience with exposure to the full project life cycle, from inception to user acceptance testing and initial live running with the experience to use the correct level of control.
Ability to combine “soft” influencing, persuasion and consultancy skills with “leadership” qualities that will encourage business leaders to positively respond to questions, inquires and requests to meet deadlines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, capable of working with people at all levels within and external to the business.
Creative, proactive, logical and innovative and will not just accept the status quo.
Highly results driven, with the energy and determination to succeed in a very fast paced environment where the pace of response and leadership is critical to success.
Experience working in the insurance sector a plus.
An independent thinker with the ability to multi task in a fast paced environment
Beneficial Skills
Experience of waterfall and agile project delivery, in particular scrum.
Experience working with distributed development and test teams.
Hiscox Values
At Hiscox our spirit is in Challenging Convention and everything we do is guided by our Values.
Courage: Dare to take a risk
Human: Clear, fair & inclusive
Ownership: Passionate, commercial & accountable
Integrity: Do the right thing, however hard
Connected: Together, build something better
 What Hiscox USA Offers
Competitive salary and bonus (based on personal & company performance)
Comprehensive health insurance, Vision, Dental and FSA
401(k) with competitive company matching
24 Paid time off days
10 Paid Holidays
Paid sabbaticals after 10 years of service
Dynamic, creative and values-driven culture
Modern and open office spaces, complimentary fruit and drinks
Spirit of volunteerism, social responsibility and community involvement, including matching charitable donations for qualifying non-profits via our sister non-profit company, the Hiscox USA Foundation
About Hiscox
As an international specialist insurer we are far removed from the world of mass market insurance products. Instead we are selective and focus on our key areas of expertise and strength - all of which is underpinned by a culture that encourages us to challenge convention and always look for a better way of doing things.
We insure the unique and the interesting. And we search for the same when it comes to talented people. Hiscox is full of smart, reliable human beings that look out for customers and each other. We believe in doing the right thing, making good and rebuilding when things go wrong. Everyone is encouraged to think creatively, challenge the status quo and look for solutions.
Scratch beneath the surface and you will find a business that is solid, but slightly contrary. We like to do things differently and constantly seek to evolve. We might have been around for a long time (our roots go back to 1901), but we are young in many ways, ambitious and going places. Some people might say insurance is dull, but life at Hiscox is anything but. If that sounds good to you, get in touch.
About Hiscox US
Hiscox USA was established in 2006 to focus primarily on the needs of small and middle market commercial clients, via both the broker and direct distribution channels and is today the fastest-growing business unit within the Hiscox Group.
Today, Hiscox USA has a talent force of about 420 employees mostly operating out of 6 major cities - New York, Atlanta, Dallas, Chicago, Los Angeles and San Francisco. Hiscox USA offers a broad portfolio of commercial products, including technology, cyber & data risk, multiple professional liability lines, media, entertainment, management liability, crime, kidnap & ransom, commercial property and terrorism.
Diversity and flexible working at Hiscox
At Hiscox we care about our people. We hire the best people for the job and we’re committed to diversity and creating a truly inclusive culture, which we believe drives success. We also understand that working life doesn’t always have to be ‘nine to five’ and we support flexible working wherever we can. No promises, but please chat to our resourcing team about the flexibility we could offer for this role.
You can follow Hiscox on LinkedIn, Glassdoor and Instagram (@HiscoxInsurance)

positionName: Business Analyst II for Health Care Core Data Assets
description:
Business Analyst II for Health Care Core Data Assets
Purpose of the role : Provide value to LexisNexis Risk Solutions’ customers by documenting, standardizing, and improving core LNRS Health Care Data. This standardization is key to enabling consistent Health Care product integration with these core data assets.
The Business Analyst II position will deliver multiple complex assigned projects aimed at delivering IT solutions and services that meet company cost, quality, and strategic targets. A Business Analyst uses interpersonal collaboration and problem-solving skills to support shared healthcare data sets on behalf of Health Care products. This role is responsible for clearly communicating with internal customers to support existing and implement new data sources. This person must be able to independently coordinate and research moderate technical activities and act as a liaison with internal stakeholders (including product management, engineering, data acquisition, quality assurance, auditing, delivery, support, and others.) This role requires heavy communication directly with internal teams and contacts. The role will predominately focus on gathering and analyzing data, defining current processes and requirements, researching best practices, and identifying and documenting process improvements and both functional and non-functional specifications.
Knowledge of LexisNexis Risk Solutions Health Care products preferred.
Knowledge of Healthcare Industry preferred.
Experience and Education
2+ years’ experience in business analysts with analytical and communication competencies demonstrated.
Bachelor’s Degree (Engineering/Computer Science preferred); or equivalent experience required.
Previous experience of working in an agile environment and using recognized development methodology; e.g., Agile, Scrum, and Kanban
Specific Responsibilities
Develops and documents standards, informs metric-driven processes, and assists interoperability requirements for LNRS HC data products with our core data platforms. Responsibilities will cover the payer, provider, life sciences, and pharmacy market segments. Priorities include improving data quality and accuracy and enabling effortless integration into product workflows.
Understand and represent customer business problems.
Create and own requirement generation.
Modify existing requirements for the core header data set to provide more accurate data.
Engage with product stakeholders to recommend integration practices; work with product teams to standardize integrations into Healthcare data.
Engage with cross functional LNRS shared services teams to align with LNRS HC product team requirements where applicable.
Support the Provider Data Quality Program.
Support LNRS Health Care business through data analysis and research.
Investigate, track, and report data issues.
Demonstrate a level of understanding within data content.
Provide technical problem solving to less technical teams (customer service, account management, etc.).
Resolve and/or guide data sources in resolving basic data issues within functional areas or data attribute types.
Produce basic ad-hoc data counts, statistics, and examples as required.
Must be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
Other Responsibilities
Develop complex systems specifications, process flow, and conversion strategies.
Maintain data model and best logic requirement documentation.
Contribute to the development of new tools, processes, and solutions to meet desired product needs.
Follow established business processes, protocols, and quality standards in the development and deployment of complex solutions.
Maintain stakeholder expectations and raise appropriate issues to project managers as necessary.
Develop “trusted advisor” relationship with senior stakeholders through effective communication and efficient, quality execution on projects.
Identify and document process improvements and functional specifications based on research of best practices and analysis of data.
Perform analysis on existing systems; identifying options for potential solutions and assess for both technical and business suitability.
Work between remote development teams, internal IT, and business to ensure requirements are being met.
All other duties as assigned.
Desired Technical Abilities
A strong knowledge of conceptual data modeling, UML modeling, data flows, data analysis, and data processing.
Proven track record of gathering business requirements and translating them into user stories/functional specifications, gained on projects of considerable scale and/or complexity.
Broad understanding of software development methodologies.
Strong facilitation skills; ability to facilitate workshops with all staff levels.
Strong communication skills that allow for effective communication across all levels of the organization.
Written communication skills including process documentation.
IT research, software analysis, and design skills.
Ability to guide and mentor less-experienced team members.
Proficient in documenting As-Is and To-Be processes.
Broad technical understanding across various methodologies, platforms, tools, and languages.
Previous experience of working in an agile environment and using recognized development methodology; e.g., Agile, SCRUM, and KANBAN.
Excellent organization/project planning, time management, and change management skills across multiple functional groups and departments, and excellent delegation skills involving prioritizing and reprioritizing projects and managing projects of various size and complexity.
Advanced problem-solving experience involving leading teams in identifying, researching, and coordinating the resources necessary to effectively troubleshoot/diagnose complex project issues; prior success extracting/translating findings into alternatives/solutions; and identifying risks/impacts and schedule adjustments to facilitate management decision-making.
Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills applicable to a wide audience including senior and executive management, customers, etc., including diction/terminology and presenting information in a concise and effective manner to clients, management, and various departments using assorted communication mediums.

The right candidate will work closely with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure delivery and implementations and provide best-in-class solutions to the clients’ business needs.

Gypsum Management & Supply, Inc. (NYSE: GMS) is the leading North American specialty distributor of interior building products. The company’s product offerings of wallboard, ceilings and complementary interior construction products are designed to provide a comprehensive solution for its core customer, the interior contractor who installs these products in commercial and residential buildings. GMS serves as a critical link between its suppliers and a highly fragmented customer base of over 20,000 contractors. The company’s operating model combines a national platform with a local go-to-market strategy, enabling GMS to generate economies of scale while maintaining the high service levels, entrepreneurial culture and customer intimacy of a local business.

Celebrating its 50th anniversary in 2021, GMS operates a national network of approximately 265 distribution centers across the U.S. and Canada and provides a one-stop-shop for all customers. The Corporate Headquarters and Yard Support Center in Tucker, Georgia serves each GMS location, providing the support needed to enable them to continue their outstanding service to contractors and builders in their local communities.

GMS’s growth strategy is centered around four core initiatives which guides the long-term management of a very attractive business with significant long-term growth potential. These strategic growth initiatives include:

Increasing market share in core products, particularly in geographies where we are under-penetrated;
Growing select complementary products outside of core products to diversify and profitably expand our product offering;
Expanding the geographic platform through accretive acquisition and greenfield opportunities and;
Leveraging our scale and employing technology and best practices to deliver a best-in-class customer experience, as well as increased productivity and further profit improvement.
GMS KEY FACTS
Headquarters: Tucker, Georgia (20 from downtown Atlanta)
Employees: Over 6,000 people who embrace a strong entrepreneurial culture
2020 Revenues: $3.2 billion
NYSE: GMS (IPO in 2016)

Market-leading distributor of interior building products with significant scale and local expertise
Differentiated service model drives market leadership

Job Overview

Fabric.com, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Amazon.com is the leading online fabric store specializing in fabric, patterns, and sewing accessories. Headquartered just outside Atlanta, Fabric.com strives to be the most trusted and inspirational fabric store in the world, providing a flawless customer experience through passion and continuous innovation. We are part of Amazon’s drive to become the Earth’s most customer-centric company.

We are seeking a self-driven, motivated Senior Financial Analyst (SFA) with a strong owner’s mindset, relentless customer advocacy, and front line obsession to join our world-class team. The SFA will own the financial reporting for the business. The SFA will partner with our business and functional teams to align financial and operational analyses, and challenging business partner assumptions when necessary. The SFA will build financial models and analyses to assist in evaluating new business concepts, turn insights into metrics, and identify specific and actionable opportunities to solve business problems. The SFA will identify the need for improved controls to address risk driven by business, industry, policy and regulatory changes and proactively propose control solutions. The SFA will be a creative and analytical problem solver with the opportunity to “Work Hard. Have Fun. Make History.”

The successful candidate will have shown experience in past roles influencing business owners and supporting decision making in rapidly evolving environments. This role requires a self-starter with strong modeling skills, a keen attention to detail, and an ability to manage multiple projects effectively. The successful candidate will have the ability to deep dive business processes and related system data flows, analyze data and identify patterns, draw conclusions, and prioritize remediation efforts to the business. This role also has regular interaction with various business units across Amazon and therefore requires strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Position Responsibilities:

Lead financial planning and analysis; build complex financial models and analytical tools to measure overall financial performance, including short and long term financial/operational forecasts, and communicate results to senior leadership
Serve as the key finance partner in performing deep dive analyses to develop recommendations that impact the decision making of senior leadership
Implement and improve policies and processes that guide fabric.com toward maintaining and improving its competitive position and profitability.
Ensure a high level of financial controllership, maintaining data integrity.
Identify and partner to implement automation and process improvements for Finance related and upstream processes and systems.
Create “learn by doing” environment by engaging with associates and managers.
Advanced degree (e.g. MBA)
Team player attitude, customer service oriented, enjoys collaboration and is self-motivated
Program management experience in high tech organization or in a consulting firm

Reengineering & Expense Management Department (REM)


REM (Reengineering & Expense Management) works in close partnership with the businesses and support functions to identify and execute opportunities to manage expenses through strategic sourcing, demand management, process reengineering and procurement management; as well as properly manage the risks that are posed by our third parties across the enterprise. REM also leverages the Source-to-Pay process to create expense data transparency and ensure vendor contract compliance.

IT Sourcing and Software Asset Management are part of the REM department. It partners with the Firm's business units to identify best practice solutions that will manage global costs and processes surrounding the acquisition of all IT related goods and services.
IT Sourcing Mission Statement
To develop and execute expense management strategies in partnership with Technology and our vendors, to optimize terms, rates, risk and time to market for the delivery of products & services that enables the Firm to achieve its profitability goals in accordance with our values.
IT Sourcing Vision
To be recognized as the leading technology expense management organization in the Financial Services industry by our team, internal stakeholders and vendors.

The Role

The analyst will support initiatives primarily from the Software Asset Management and IT Sourcing category within Morgan Stanley Firmwide Sourcing organization conducting ongoing reviews of the consumption, license entitlements and risks associated with the utilization of third-party software in the Firm.
The candidate should have extensive knowledge in software/hardware technologies, data analysis and modelling, Agile software development methodology and project management. Additionally, the candidate will require a strong knowledge of software contracts as well as software licensing models and terminology. The candidate's primary tasks will be to conduct analyses with big data to assist ongoing plant management, migrations and software deal team support, which also requires the review and extrapolation of product-specific contract details from software agreements and entering information into software licensing database and software license compliance tooling.

Responsibilities:
Project Management / Contract Analysis and Data Analytics

Focus on data integrity, predictive analysis, and report design / implementation in order to conduct software compliance analyses, demand management reporting and assist sourcing managers with identifying negotiation strategies
 Ownership for the financial analytics, data collection and reporting associated with identifying new savings opportunities related to the SAM Analytics program
 Periodic review of technology infrastructure to make recommendations and a roadmap for improvement that will gain efficiencies and improve reporting to support a best in class operation
 Apply a structured approach and methodology for all required change efforts, including project plans, communication plans, and training plans
 Review software consumption, licensing, and entitlements through the entire project lifecycle to assist in risk mitigation and cost savings decisions
 Manage to project timelines for global projects, Internal and External Audits, True-Ups and Declarations and other initiatives
 Review existing software contracts for various licensing terms and record information in software licensing database as required
Ensure SAM team standardizes vendor, software, and version names as part of an internal software catalog as required
 Support low dollar procurement / tactical buying as required by executing software sourcing deals
 Translate objectives to detailed and actionable project plan and tasks while identifying activity dependencies, priorities, and critical paths
Review project status with senior management and proactively remediate potential risks
 Provide offshore staff with a strong day?to?day leadership presence in establishing, prioritizing, and coordinating operational projects, considering resource needs, timelines, improvements to the controls and efficiency of processes, and impact on savings to the Firm?s bottom line
Create a framework for managing and measuring performance of our offshore team to optimize cycles, increase capacity and maintain the highest level of throughput
Complete complex data models to ascertain software compliance risk across numerous platforms and vendors

QUALIFICATIONS
The successful candidate will be a seasoned professional with experience in Software Asset Management and IT Sourcing. Additionally, the candidate will have experience in strategy, data management and reporting, operations, and technology.
More specifically, qualifications ought to include:
 5+ years experience leading SAM Team data and reporting initiatives in a fast-paced environment with a demonstrated ability to meet goals and deadlines
 3+ years experience in a management role and working with global teams
 Experience reviewing and interpreting software contracts to determine software license attributes and entitlements
 Experience with leveraging SQL to extract data and an understanding of relational databases
 Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel with the ability to join large amounts of data through SQL queries and a strong proficiency in the use of advanced formulas and pivot tables
 Proven experience in data analytics and reporting. Experience using Tableau, Microsoft Power Query, Power BI etc. is a plus
 Thorough understanding of data relationships and granularity issues
 Experience in complex, global industries with a strong customer-centric focus and a track record of success working in a team-based environment
 Commercially focused with an assertive personality to provide recommendations and findings to stakeholders in Sourcing, Technology and Business Units
 Experience in business process reengineering, utilizing recognized industry best practices and tooling to optimize and reengineer business practices
 Experience with Agile methodologies and Kanban to optimize team workload and capacity planning
Ability to manage expectations of internal clients and stakeholder teams for complex projects with dependencies
Proficient in computer technology and software installation
 A demonstrated ability to think strategically and act as a thought-partner with teammates, senior leadership, and key stakeholders is critically important

positionName: Senior Data Engineer, Architect, or Analyst
description:
Title Senior Data Engineer, Architect, or Analyst

Location Atlanta, GA Travel Requirements up to 75%

Position Description We are currently seeking to fill a Senior Data Architect & Analyst position. The position requires 5 – 15 years of prior experience as a data analyst or architect. The position is a consultative technical position working with large enterprise customers who will implement data management solutions on multiple BI platforms. We are looking for a candidate who can interact directly with our clients to consult, solicit business rules, design and build solutions to address the client’s business intelligence and/or data management challenges. The Senior Data Architect & Analyst maybe required to build, modify, and maintain data entities based on customer requirements and initiatives. This position requires working well in teams, as well as independently on projects. As a customer facing position, excellent communication (oral and written), customer expectation management, responsiveness to customer needs, being proactive in anticipating technical challenges, being meticulous and having a consultative approach are extremely important to be successful in this position.

The ideal candidate will be responsive to customer needs, take a proactive approach in anticipating technical and political challenges throughout a project, have great organization skills with attention to detail, and will take a consultative approach to solving complex Data Management issues.

Candidates must have advanced skills to query and manipulate data using both SQL and Excel. Candidates must demonstrate proficiency in making useful inferences and driving improvement actions from large data sets that are messy and not easily understood. There may be up to 75% travel required and daily work activities are managed within a virtual environment supported by the ability to telecommute. Major Objectives Analytical: Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common technical journals, and documents.

Problem Solving: Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.

Interpersonal: Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.

Oral Communication: Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings.

Team Work: Balances team and individual responsibilities; Ability to multi task and manage multiple projects and priorities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed; Recognizes accomplishments of other team members.

Attendance/Punctuality: Is consistently at work and on time; Ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; Arrives at meetings and appointments on time.

Dependability: Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.

Innovation: Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Generates suggestions for improving work; Develops innovative approaches and ideas; Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' attention.

Motivation: Sets and achieves challenging goals; Demonstrates persistence and overcomes obstacles; Measures self against standard of excellence; Takes calculated risks to accomplish goals.

Who You'll Work With
You will work in our McKinsey Client Capabilites Network in Dallas, Atlanta or Waltham and will be part of our Wave Transformatics team.
Wave equips clients to successfully manage improvement programs and transformations. Focused on business impact, Wave allows clients to track the impact of individual initiatives and understand how they affect longer term goals. It is a mix of an intuitive interface and McKinsey business expertise that gives clients a simple and insightful picture of what can otherwise be a complex process by allowing them to track the progress and performance of initiatives against business goals, budget and time frames.
Our Transformatics team provides analytics insights to consulting teams and clients across the globe. The team is composed of data scientists and data engineers who work across a variety of industries, functions and analytics methodologies and platforms – e.g. predictive analytics, natural language processing, data engineering, advanced statistics & machine learning.
What You'll Do
You will work closely with other data scientists, data engineers, product developers and other analytics focused consultants to integrate advanced analytics capabilities into the Wave product.
In this role you will be responsible for presenting actionable results to client management and influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance of their transformation program. You will also be supporting knowledge development for the firm’s transformation consultancy group and help developing a roadmap for a greater understanding of analytics and its impact in the consulting population.
You will also work with our client service teams globally and be a part of analytics focused engagements. You will demonstrate depth of knowledge in using advanced statistics, optimization techniques and machine learning algorithms. You will work on various modelling assignments to derive actionable business insights and solve complex business problems in multi-disciplinary environments.
You will support McKinsey practices in delivering articles and white papers on various subjects around transformation programs. You’ll have the opportunity to gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. In addition, you’d also be expected to coach and mentor other colleagues on advanced analytics topics, enabling them to grow and learn.

Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

About Us:
Metas Solutions is a professional services firm headquartered in Atlanta, GA. We are an 8(a)-certified, Woman Owned Small Business (WOSB/EDWOSB) with two offices in Atlanta Chamblee/Brookhaven and downtown Atlanta in the historic Pittsburgh community. Metas is a full-service consulting firm focused on implementing public health and information technology (IT) solutions for our clients. We specialize in Health Informatics, Data Analytics, SharePoint Design and Transformation, Capacity Building and Technical Assistance, Evaluation, Strategy, and Population Health Strategies.
Job Description:
Metas Solutions has an "immediate opening" for an experienced Mid-Level Public Health Data Analyst to work in Atlanta, GA with the possibility of working remote after a probationary period and with supervisor approval. Candidates for this role will be expected to independently set and meet milestones, coordinate with other members of a multi- disciplinary Agile project team to complete deliverables, schedule, and conduct meetings with government staff, and build interactive data reports for internal and external users, to include clinical datasets, disease surveillance datasets etc. The candidate will be required to provide customer service support to users of an application developed to streamline, consolidate, manage and track program compliance in support of publicly funded vaccine distribution including responding to inquiries around program policy and user support to program awardees and is an integral part of the program's operations, including analyzing system data, triaging tickets, responding to phone calls, taking clear and detailed weekly meeting minute notes and occasional ad-hoc as required, and being responsive to all internal CDC users and VFC awardees.
Responsibilities:
Data mining, analysis, and mapping with large datasets.
Conducting qualitative and quantitative data analyses and presenting results to client.
Identifying opportunities for process improvements in program operations, and work with the QA specialist to provide useful testing support on all new and enhanced program functionality.
Consistently apply the steps and processes of a Standard Operating Procedure.
Investigate and quickly understand the capabilities of existing systems and technologies already in use across a program area.
Use data modeling tools to perform data modeling.
Providing customer support to CDC internal system users and awardees by providing phone and email support to users of the application.
Qualifications:
BA/BS required with 3-5 years of relevant experience, preferably within a federal agency, public health organization, or state-based public health program.
Master's degree (Master of Public Health) is preferred but not required.
Experience with data modeling tools.
Experience with any of the following technologies: SAS, R, R Shiny, Power BI, Tableau, Business Objects, Mongo DB, Java, JSON, MSSQL.
Strong proficiency in MS Excel (e.g., pivot tables, calculations, custom formulas, VLOOKUP), Word, and PowerPoint.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to provide outstanding customer service
Expertise writing functional, non-functional and data requirements for data analytics or other software applications.
Having a demonstrated understanding of SDLC methodologies is highly desired.
Proficiency with data mining, data analysis, and performing data quality to include development and use of custom formulas in Excel and basic SQL queries and interpretation of data for business and programmatic purpose.
Knowledge of HPQC is a plus.
Preferred experience with analytical tools related to public health applications.
Preferred candidate will have experience with statistical analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence applications.
Ability to apply critical thinking skills and solve problems within a technical team.
This is a full-time role that requires on-site government access and client site location (temporary full time telework exists due to the ongoing Covid pandemic; ongoing part time telework approved after probationary period).
Security Requirements:
Must be eligible for a public trust clearance or higher and will undergo a background check to successfully obtain a federal contractor badge.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

positionName: Data Analyst, Delivery Speed to Customer
description:

This position reports to Manager

This position has no Direct Reports

Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant condition

Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problems solving.
An unquenchable intellectual curiosity for getting at the underlying story being told within the data.

 2+ years of experience working as Business Analyst/Product Owner in developing requirements, write use cases and creating requirements documents and process flows focused in custom software development/ Platforms.

Job Description
Business System Analysts (BSA) at CapTech work side-by-side with key business and technical stakeholders to elicit solution requirements, drive the solution design, and ensure the finished product meets the needs of the business. Our BSAs work on a variety of projects from mobile and content management systems, to large integration and modernization efforts spanning multiple lines of business. BSAs at CapTech bridge the gap between business and technology to ensure solutions provide the value the business needs as well as being scalable and maintainable to support the ever-changing needs of the organization. CapTech BSAs are called upon to provide leadership through experience and help shape the strategy of our clients.
Specific responsibilities for the Business System Analyst position include:
Quickly become familiar with client business challenges and technologies in order to act as a SME and trusted advisor to client stakeholders.
Act as key player in a team environment through all phases of the system delivery lifecycle.
Assist the technical team in solution design including data modeling, interface design, and state transition definition.
Analyze data to understand the current state data structures and quality and how the data might impact the business objectives of the client.
Provide connection between technical and business views to ensure that high quality and impactful solutions are delivered for our clients.
Evaluate the current state of an organization and work with the client to define the desired future state
Perform gap analysis to identify capability gaps within the organization and propose and evaluate alternative solutions that will fulfill the business needs.
Coordinate integration and user acceptance testing activities.
Work with client stakeholders to understand high level business needs and elicit detailed requirements using various methods.

Qualifications
Specific qualifications for the Business System Analyst position include:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience
Demonstrated progression and growth as a Business Systems Analyst through past career experiences with a minimum of 3 years of experience on IT-related projects.
Familiarity with multi-system integration and common issues that can arise when integrating enterprise technologies.
Experience creating sequence, data flow, and process flow diagrams that visualize the future state.
Awareness of object-oriented development practices and the ability to define objects within an organization and individual processes.
Understanding of modern IT architecture solutions (Cloud, APIs, etc.).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills leveraged to interface with senior business leadership and technical resources.
Ability to write and perform basic SQL queries required.
Software development work or education experience preferred.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite as well as agile project management software (e.g. JIRA).
Prior consulting experience preferred.
